Isaiah or Isaias__41.1: Let the islands keep silence before me, and the nations take new strength: let them come near, and then speak, let us come near to judgment together.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.2: Who hath raised up the just one from the east, hath called him to follow him? he shall give the nations in his sight, and he shall rule over kings: he shall give them as the dust to his sword, as stubble driven by the wind, to his bow.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.3: He shall pursue them, he shall pass in peace, no path shall appear after his feet.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.4: Who hath wrought and done these things, calling the generations from the beginning? I the Lord, I am the first and the last.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.5: The islands saw it, and feared, the ends of the earth were astonished, they drew near, and came.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.6: Every one shall help his neighbour, and shall say to his brother: Be of good courage.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.7: The coppersmith striking with the hammer encouraged him that forged at that time, saying: It is ready for soldering: and he strengthened it with nails, that it should not be moved.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.8: But thou Israel, art my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend:
Isaiah or Isaias__41.9: In whom I have taken thee from the ends of the earth, and from the remote parts thereof have called thee, and said to thee: Thou art my servant, I have chosen thee, and have not cast thee away.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.10: Fear not, for I am with thee: turn not aside, for I am thy God: I have strengthened thee, and have helped thee, and the right hand of my just one hath upheld thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.11: Behold all that fight against thee shall be confounded and ashamed, they shall be as nothing, and the men shall perish that strive against thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.12: Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find the men that resist thee: they shall be as nothing: and as a thing consumed the men that war against thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.13: For I am the Lord thy God, who take thee by the hand, and say to thee: Fear not, I have helped thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.14: Fear not, thou worm of Jacob, you that are dead of Israel: I have helped thee, saith the Lord: and thy Redeemer the Holy One of Israel.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.15: I have made thee as a new thrashing wain, with teeth like a saw: thou shall thrash the mountains, and break them in pieces: and shalt make the hills as chaff.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.16: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the Lord, in the Holy One of Israel thou shalt be joyful.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.17: The needy and the poor seek for waters, and there are none: their tongue hath been dry with thirst. I the Lord will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.18: I will open rivers in the high bills, and fountains in the midst of the plains: I will turn the desert into pools of waters, and the impassable land into streams of waters.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.19: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, and <u>the thorn</u>, and the myrtle, and the olive tree: I will set in the desert the fir tree, the elm, and the box tree together:
Isaiah or Isaias__41.20: That they may see and know, and consider, and understand together that the hand of the Lord hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.21: Bring your cause near, saith the Lord: bring hither, if you have any thing to allege, saith the King of Jacob.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.22: Let them come, and tell us all things that are to come: tell us the former things what they were: and we will set our heart upon them, and shall know the latter end of them, and tell us the things that are to come.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.23: shew the things that are to come hereafter, and we shall know that ye are gods. Do ye also good or evil, if you can: and let us speak, and see together.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.24: Behold, you are of nothing, and your work of that which hath no being: he that hath chosen you is an abomination.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.25: I have raised up one from the north, and he shall come from the rising of the sun: he shall call upon my name, and he shall make princes to be as dirt, and as the potter treading clay.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.26: Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know: and from time of old, that we may say: Thou art just. There is none that sheweth, nor that foretelleth, nor that heareth your words.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.27: The first shall say to Sion: Behold they are here, and to Jerusalem I will give an evangelist.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.28: And I saw, and there was no one even among them to consult, or who, when I asked, could answer a word.
Isaiah or Isaias__41.29: Behold they are all in the wrong, and their works are vain: their idols are wind and vanity.
